comments.body:
@tedyu I don't feel super strongly, but one advantage of logging this using `klog.V(3).Infof` would be that it is consistent with the logging statement on line 190. I don't have a ton of context on this part of the code base, but I do get the sense they are describing equally bad failure states... in other words, it seems sensible to me that they'd have the same log level.

Alternatively, I suppose we could change both to be a `Warning`.

@mattjmcnaughton that was my initial rational around consistency. I believe this error and a number of others logged at debug are generally ok to ignore as they should be self-resolving through subsequent sync loops. You would probable only want to see them when you find a definitive problem case (like what I am trying to root cause).
Gotcha! So just to be sure we're on the same page, are you planning on changing it to `klog.V(3).Infof`? Or is there a reason more important than consistency for it to be `klog.Warningf`?

@mattjmcnaughton In the original PR I had it at v3 info and per the discussion with @tedyu I changed it to warn. I am on the side of having it an v3 info and am happy to change it back it everyone is happy with that per my explanation.
@tedyu what do you think? I vote `klog.V(3).Infof` :)
Looking at the log on line 190, I think it should be warning as well:)

i think it's valid to move away from setting ToCgroupfs() for the systemd case.
and as far as i can see the `""` parent, would not get any special treatment in the case of the docker service.

but there could be hidden implications here.
Is this list used elsewhere?  If so, can we move it up to a constant so we have a single source of truth?
this looks weird.  if it's just a prefix, `basePath[len(podCgroupNamePrefix):]` is clearer, IMO
